name: A-B-C Of Everyday Inventions Trivia Game | Scientists & Inventors | 10 Questions

questions.text: A- Who invented the first controllable flying AEROPLANE (AIRPLANE)?
questions.explanation:
Wright Brothers.

	Wilbur and Orville Wright made the first successful controlled powered flight at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina, in December 1903. The twelve second flight covered a distance of 120 feet and an altitude of just ten feet.

questions.text: B- Who invented the BALL POINT PEN?
questions.explanation:
Biro Brothers.

	The Hungarian brothers, Laszlo and George Biro, made the first ball point pen in 1894. It followed the first workable fountain pen which was invented by L.E. Waterman in 1884.

questions.text: C- CORN FLAKES - Who made them first?
questions.explanation:
Kellogg.

	Will Keith Kellogg discovered the corn flake, by mistake, in 1906. They were the result of an experiment which went wrong.

questions.text: D- Who had an explosive idea and first patented dynamite?
questions.explanation:
A. Nobel

	Alfred Noble patented dynamite in 1876. Nobel left $9 million in his will to be used as awards for people whose work benefit humanity - The Nobel Peace Prize etc.

questions.text: E- The ELECTRIC BATTERY, who's charged with inventing this one?
questions.explanation:
Volta.

	Italian, Alessandro Volta discovered the first practical battery in 1800. Life would be very different without batteries.

questions.text: F- FROZEN FOOD - Who discovered the first practical method of freezing food?
questions.explanation:
C. Birdseye

	In the 1920s Clarence Birdseye discovered that if food was flash-frozen under pressure, it would freeze without the formation of ice crystals.

Cohen & Boyer.

	Genetic Engineering, the technique of DNA cloning was perfected by Stanley Cohen and Herbert Boyer in 1973. [the ultimate designer genes!]

questions.text: H- It travels over land and water.  Who invented the HOVERCRAFT?
questions.explanation:
C. Cockerell

	Christopher Cockerell invented the hovercraft in 1956. His early experiments with the idea involved a cat food tin, a coffee tin and an industrial blower.

questions.text: I- Who came up with the idea for INSTANT MASHED POTATO?
questions.explanation:
E.  Asselbergs

	Instant mash was invented by Edward A Asselbergs, a Canadian, in 1962. The mash is actually dehydyated potato flakes.

questions.text: J- Who was the first person to patent the JET ENGINE?
questions.explanation:
F. Whittle

	British inventor Frank Whittle was the first to patent his design for a jet engine in 1930. Although an engine designed by Dr. Hans Von Ohain was the first to fly in 1939. Whittle's jet engine first flew in 1941.  [Look out for the next installment]
